name: Holiday Inn Express Rochester - Greece

reviews.text: Nice quiet hotel in a great location and a nice breakfast and morning paper included. Express Check-out appreciated. The free HD-TV is what most impressed me. Refusing to have to pay for it at home it was a real treat to watch my Sunday NFL games in HD. King bed was very comfortable and the bathroom is one of those with the sink and dressing area in the room. A real plus if travelling with your partner. Loive Garden is across the street and the taxi driver said there is a major mall just down the street. I did not go to either. The only negative I would have would be the ancient and slow, noisy single elevator. A bit scary.
reviews.title: Awesome free HD-TV

reviews.text: We were in town for a wedding and had a very hard time picking a nice place to stay. Relatives picked this place so we followed them and found it to be nice. The continental breakfast included eggs, bacon and pancakes which made it stand out from most free breakfasts I've had.
reviews.title: I would go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and comfortable sized for my family of 4. My kids are too big to share a bed so we generally bring along a single airbed for my son and he was able to fit very nicely at the foot of the bed while I shared a double with my daughter and my husband slept alone. I liked the refrigerator. The TV was a bit tricky and my son had messed it up by hitting the wrong button on top when trying to turn it on and we couldn't figure it out because the remote had dead batteries, but the girl at the desk was very nice and promptly came up to fix it for us then went back down and brought back the batteries. No biggie, these things happen. I was pleased the staff was so nice. We asked for a quiet room on an upper floor with no allergens and that is what we got.
reviews.title: Except for size of the bathroom a nice place to stay.

reviews.text: There seemed to be a school of some kind outside our room window which made me consider that a person trying to sleep during a weekday or maybe a family with a napping child might want to request a room away from the school, but that's all I saw that made me stop and wonder.
reviews.title: Great location great customer service

reviews.text: Overall I would go back again, no complaints.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.text: This was our second time to stay at this hotel. We have family in Rochester and this hotel is in an easily accessible location. The previous experience was two years ago and was pleasant. This time we started off on the wrong foot and continued that way for the duration.
reviews.title: Disappointed with our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked two rooms for a three night stay back in mid March. We requested connecting rooms and were told that this hotel does not have any. They said they would note that we wanted adjoining rooms. This wasn't the most ideal situation (the second room was for our teenagers), however we were okay with it.
reviews.title: very good - would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fast forward four months. We arrived at 3:20 P.M. on 07/16/11 to find out that our rooms were not together as requested. Not only were they not together, they were on the exact opposite ends of the hotel. Seriously, the rooms could not have been farther apart unless they were in separate hotels. They informed us that these were the only two rooms available, but we could move the kids closer the following night. We reluctantly accepted and went our separate ways.
reviews.title: Gold/Platinum Lounge was a great touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next disappointment was finding that our King room that we reserved was actually a double bed room. We accepted this because our youngest child could now stay with us. My wife was less than thrilled about the day so far, but it got worse. We returned to the hotel around 9:45 P.M. after visiting family to find that the entire hotel did not have hot water. The front desk could only tell us that they had called the maintenance guy and he was "on the way". The kids took cold showers that night. Fun! After trying to get to sleep, we heard a small pack of girls roaming the hallways. We had seen them checking their FB accounts in the business center earlier. The noise didn't last long, but it was enough to be irritating.
reviews.title: The Best Staff!

reviews.text: The following day we had our kids moved next door to us. We requested a roll away bed and were told that they cost $10 per night. After reminding them about the King bed screw-up, we didn't have to pay anything. We settled in that night and we were going to watch a movie with the kids. They went through the pay-per-views and came to an agreement on a movie. We tried to purchase the movie, but we were denied. After calling the front desk, we were told that the hotel does not subscribe to that service. Defeated, we went to bed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Nice, clean, hotel with helpful staff. Had an enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: I have stayed here multiple times in the past 2 years. I travel for business as a Sales VP and work all across Upstate NY. This hotel is my first choice for the Rochester, NY area. This Holiday Inn Express is extremely clean, nice rooms, has a great breakfast, very fast internet and reasonable rates. The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. It is nice that they have copies of New York Times available each weekday in the lobby in addition to the USA Today. The bathrooms are small, however, the sink is located just outside the bathroom so that works well.
reviews.title: Top pick!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This location has a Priority Club lounge on the second floor for Gold and Platinum members. It has a large screen TV, large couches and is stocked with snacks and soft drinks/bottled water for the guests. That is nice!
reviews.title: awesome breakfast

reviews.text: This hotel has various Restaurants choices real close by including: Dave's Famous BBQ, Five Guys, Uno Chicago Grill and Perkins. The Olive Garden and The Distillery are within walking distance.
reviews.title: No problems.

reviews.text: When I travel to Rochester this is the first hotel I pick.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here while visiting relatives in the area. We had requested a quiet room, but upon check-in were told that they were full and they could not adjust our room. The room was near the elevator. There were a bunch of kids sports teams staying in the hotel on our first night. They were quite noisy, running up and down the hall at 10pm at night. The rooms are not very sound proof. We kept the fan in the bathroom on to try to block the noise. The breakfast was very poor. The only thing edible was the bagels. We had just stayed in another HIE in Albany, which was much better. We won't be staying here on our next trip.
reviews.title: Noisy, bad breakfast

reviews.text: I've stayed in the hotel a few times since it opened, and the last time was 3 years ago. It is starting to show it's age (carpets in halls and rooms dirty, walls need painting, etc.), but it's still a good place to stay. The sink/counter are a beautiful tourquoise, and it's located outside the tub/shower and toilet room. The open vanity shelves provide lots of storage for toiletries or folded clothes. Dresser and closet space is also available. Other features include a flat screen TV, upholstered chair, work desk, mini refrigerator, & small microwave. There are plenty of outlets and no wi fi connection problems. A hot/cold buffet is included with standard continental fare. The fitness center is small with only 1 tradmill, 1 bike, 1 eliptcal and a weight machine and doesn't open until 6:30 AM. The business center includes 2 computer stations in a private room vs. in the open lobby, and the USA Today and NY Times are complimentary. The elevator was VERY slow. My key didn't work upon check-in and I had to make a trip back down to the lobby. Then the TV didn't come on, but maintenance responded immediately and it was only that the cable box was off.The front desk clerks are helpful, but have no personality and move slowly. The location is close to expressways and walking distance to restaurants. The airport is approx, 15 min away.
reviews.title: Aging, but still good

reviews.text: This place is a dump
reviews.title: dump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stained carpet front door of rm stained carpet ifo sink unknown white substance and hair on desk chair; urine stains on tile ifo of toilet!!!!
reviews.title: Great Place To Stay

reviews.text: The service was great. Room was a good size. Clean. Located next to many resturants. Overall I'd recommend 100%.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

aka: Holiday Inn Express Rochester - Greece Hotel Rochester
description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express Hotel in Rochester-Greece Enjoy a relaxing stay at our Rochester, New York hotel, which offers you premium amenities and an ideal location off Route 104, with quick access to the Rochester business district. Our Rochester hotel is conveniently located near area attractions including Seabreeze Amusement and Water Park, Highland Park, the Seneca Zoo, and Geva Theater, all just a few miles from our hotel in Rochester, NY. Local sports teams include the Red Wings baseball team, the new Rochester Razorsharks basketball team, Rhinos Soccer and the Rochester Americans hockey team. If shopping is your preference, check out the Mall at Greece Ridge, with over 100 unique shops, just one mile from our Rochester, NY hotel. Business travelers looking for a hotel convenient to Rochester Airport (ROC) will benefit from our location near many area businesses such as Frontier Corp, Delphi, Eastman Kodak, Carestream Health and Bausch & Lomb. Close to our Rochester hotel are several area colleges including the University of Rochester, SUNY Brockport, Rochester Institute of Technology, Roberts Wesleyan and Nazareth College. Our Rochester, New York hotel aims to bring you top service and comfort with a 24-hour Fitness Center, free high-speed Internet access, a meeting room and a complimentary hot breakfast bar. Book your Rochester hotel room now and Stay Smart at our Holiday Inn Express in Rochester, NY.
